intro: Leucopogon subsejunctus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in wet, boggy environments and is often found in swamps and pine flatwoods. Its botanical structure reflects its adaptation to moist, nutrient-poor habitats.
